title: Thunderbird now locking up (unresponsive) when downloading messages - sometimes for up to a minute or two
content: Since upgrading to 140.0esr on Thunderbird, client freezes (Windows 11 indicates as "Thunderbird is not responding") for anything from a couple of seconds up to a minute or two whenever downloading emails in the background. This is very annoying, especially when trying to write a new message (or even while commenting here in the Ideas panel). My main account is on a Microsoft Exchange service, so I need to use the OWL add-in but the delays also seem to occur when accessing gmail. The other "feature" which seems to have changed is inbox defaulting to top then running through to end when sorted with most recent at bottom. I have now reversed to have most recent on top, which seems to have resolved, but this was also annoying. Attempted to resolve by clearing 1 GB from cache and archiving about 15K conversations - but interruptions not significantly improved. Until a few days ago Thunderbird seemed to run without any problems. Any suggestions?
creator: richard29

title: İleti gönderilmesi başarısız oldu hatası.
content:
Merhaba, Uzun süredir thunderbird kullanıcısıyız , firmamızda 2 bilgisayar şeklinde sorunsuz çalışıyorken yaklaşık 1 haftadır bu aşağıdaki hata ile karşılaşıyorum. Ne yaptıysak çözüm bulamadık , Sürüm 115.18.0 (64 bit) güncelleme denetledim ve güncel sürüm diyor.

1 Fotoğraf : Hesap kurulum ekranı 2 Fotoğraf : Kurulum sonrası , Gelen sunucu ayarı 3 Fotoğraf : Kurulum sonrası , Giden sunucu ayarı 4 Fotoğraf : Alınan Hata.

Tüm veri dosyalarını kaldırıp tekrardan her 2 bilgisayarda kurulum gerçekleşltirdim, ama sonuç değişmedi. Ve bu olay normal kullanırken ayar değişimi yapmadan kendiliğinden oluştu.

Lütfen yardımcı olursanız sevinirim.

title: Outgoing email SMTP timeouts after Thunderbird update
content:
Had this problem suddenly crop up since the update of one of my accounts not sending mail due to timeouts. I've not changed any passwords or settings since I had it working last. The message is the "Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because the connection to Outgoing server (SMTP) [my workplace's SMTP server] timed out. Try again." one, and it's preventing me from sending any emails.

Specifics:

  • It's one account (my work one: work runs an Outlook/Microsoft mail server).
  • My personal account (gmail) sends fine. Both accounts recieve email fine too, so this is just one direction on one account.

Things I've tried:

  • Switching my Firewall off makes no difference, so it's not a firewall problem
  • It's not that the emails I'm trying to send are too large, one word test emails also don't send
  • Extending the timeout time by 3x doesn't help

I also opened a second computer not yet running the latest version - the account worked fine. Then applied the upgrade and that broke things in exactly the same way as described above. So I'm pretty sure this is an issue caused by the upgrade in some way. Not sure if other people with Outlook servers are having the same problem or if there's any workaround available but would appreciate advice.
creator: james43

title: Invio mail in automatico
content:
Buongiorno vi scrivo perché è da un po' di tempo che ho riscontrato un problema con Thunderbird in risposta a una mail. Mi capita sempre più spesso che quando rispondo ad una mail mentre sto scrivendo, automaticamente thunderbird mi invii la mail senza che io lo abbia richiesto. Ho verificato e non si tratta dello short Cut command + invio, perchè ho abilitato la richiesta e non me lo farebbe fare se non do l'ok. Il risultato è che il cliente si ritrova tre o quattro mail incomplete prima di ricevere l'ultima finale completa. Qualcuno ha già riscontrato questo problema?

Good morning, I'm writing because I've been having a problem with Thunderbird for a while now when replying to emails. It's becoming increasingly common for me to find that when I reply to an email while I'm writing, Thunderbird automatically sends me the email without me asking for it. I checked, and it's not the Cut command + Send shortcut; I enabled the request, and it won't let me do it unless I give it permission. The result is that the client ends up with three or four incomplete emails before receiving the final, complete one. Has anyone encountered this problem before?
creator: studio.lobe

title: Either my email timestamps are wrong or my calendar appointment times are wrong; I have to choose
content:
This is a weird one. For a few months now, I've had to deal with either my email timestamps being wrong, or my calendar appointment times being wrong.

I'm on Linux. I can replicate this with both the Flatpak and my distribution package.

By default, my email timestamps are fine. But my calendar appointment times are out by around 17 hours (that is, Thunderbird says they are happening 17 hours earlier than they actually are). I compare this to my Fossify Calendar app on my phone, which I had to install recently so I had a single source of truth, which is always correct. (It uses davx5 OSE as a bridge)

So the appointments themselves...are fine. My other calendar app can display them okay.

If I want to get the appointment times to display correctly, the only way is to set an environment variable. Regardless of whether I set my timezone manually in Calendar settings or use the system timezone (which is correct!), nothing changes. This is the only way to get it to work:

``` TZ=Australia/AEST thunderbird ```

or:

``` TZ=Australia/AEST flatpak run org.mozilla.Thunderbird ```

Now, my appointment times are correct...but my email timestamps are off! They are 11 hours behind what they should be. Despite this being my actual timezone.

I don't know what else to do. Please, is there any way to get my timestamps consistent for both my email and my appointments?

(sequel to this thread: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1506824 )
creator: firefox2506

title: Thunderbird folder not visible in App/Data/Roaming
content: I would like to back up my huge email history which is saved in numerous sub-folder folders on my Windows 11 computer. According to Thunderbird settings, my profile should be at the default location: C:\Users\jorda\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\5ypfc1q9.default-release\ImapMail\imap.dreamhost.com But when I open the AppData folder, there is no sub-folder named "Thunderbird". In the "View" menu, "show hidden items" is checked. In the Troubleshooting menu, under Application Basics, Profile Folder, when I click on "Open Folder (Local drive)", I get a message saying: "C\Users\jorda\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\5ypfc1q9.default-release is unavailable. If the locatoin is on this PC, make sure the device or drive is connected or the disc is inserted, and then try again. If the location is on a network, make sure you're connected to the network or Internet, and then try again. If the location still can't be found, it might have been moved or deleted". Yet Thunderbird is still working fine and all my past emails are accessible. I'm stumped - can anyone help me find or expose my Thunderbird profile folder?
creator: jordan5
